div.l: A prentys whilom̄ dwelled in our͗e Citee
Of a Craft / of vitailers was he
And gaylard was he as a goldfyncch in þe shawe
Broun̄ as a bery a ꝓpropre short felawe
Wᵗith lokkes blake / kembed full fetislye
Daunce he coude so wele and iolilye
That he was cleped Perkyn̄ Reveloᵘur
He was as full of love and ꝑparamour͗e
As is the hyve full of hony swete
Wele was the wenche wᵗith hym myght mete
At eủery bridale wold he synge and hoppe
He loued better the taủerne than the shoppe
For whan there ony ridyng was in chepe
Out of þe Shop̄ thider wold he lepe
Till that he hade all þe sight yseyn̄
And daunced well he nold nat com̄ ageyn̄
And gadred hym a meyne of his sort
To harp̄ and syng and make soch desport
And there þey sette steven for to mete
To pleye at dys in soch a strete
For in þe toun̄ nas there no prentise
That feyrer couthe cast a peir͗e of dise
Than Perkyn̄ couth / and therto he was fre
Of his dispence in place of privitee
That fonde his maistre wele in his chaffare
For oft tyme / he fond his boxe full bare
For sothly a prentys a Reuelour͗e
That haunteth dys ryot and ꝑparamour͗e
His maister shall it in his shop̄ abye
All haue he no ꝑpart of the mynstralcye
For theft and ryot they ben̄ conuertible
All can̄ he pleye on̄ gyterne or ribible
Reuell and trouth as in a lowe degree
They ben̄ fall wroth all day as men may se
This ioly prentys wᵗith his maister stode
Till he was nye out of his app̉renticehode
All were he snebbed both erly and late
And som̄ tyme lad wᵗith reuell to Newgate
But at the last his maister͗e hym bethought
Vp on̄ a day whan he his paꝑpere sought
